topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55484c16636872684c1c0a00#post_55484c16636872684c1c0a00
I'm actually excited for the movie adaptation of civil war, cause you have two totally human characters going at it.  Captain has very little powers, how many times has he gotten shot again, versus a millionaire that without his suit anybody can kill.

Think about it; everyone remembers the Captain America quote "You're my mission" "Then finish it".  On the other hand give me *ONE* quote you remember from the Superman movie; any quote at all.

Calling it now:
Marvel: Civil War >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Superman vs Batman.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
I'm kind of sick of the people that go all like "Saitama is a bad character because nothing can beat him".

His conflict is that his immense power completely alienates him from the rest of the world. (Everyone's fighting for their lives all of the time and he never even gets phased. And he hates it.)

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55484e2e63687201ea4b0a00#post_55484e2e63687201ea4b0a00
Basically, it's a different take to the usual and overused superhero backstory and growth. Other superheroes grow by learning their mistakes and such, getting stronger, standing up again yadda yadda but Saitama doesn't have to do that. He's already strong, he beats opponents in one hit which makes nearly zero mistakes and he doesn't even need to stand up. He hates it though by the way.

It's good to see something different.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/554850c963687201ea930d00#post_554850c963687201ea930d00
You're missing my fucking point dude.

He isn't a good character solely because he's strong enough to beat anything in one punch. He's a good character Because he's a human being first and foremost. (He hates that absolutely nothing can give him a challenge anymore and that no one can understand just how he feels.)

For a comparison, Imagine *having* to turn god mode on in every video game you play ever, And you can't turn it off ever. That's his life.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184
